item.title: Injectable Collagen-Chitosan Hydrogel loaded with Human Induced Pluripotent Stem-Cells for Myocardial Regeneration
item.description: We conducted a literature review and proposed an injectable collagen-chitosan hydrogel loaded with hiPSC-CMs for myocardium regeneration. In adittion, we proposed a phase I clinical trial to test the safety and effectiveness of the product. We defined the inclusion and exclusion criteria for patient selection, and the methods and techniques for monitoring the outcome measures. For more information about the project, please refer to the ‘PDF’ button above.

item.title: Polyethylene glycol (PEG) liposomes with folate for the delivery of methotrexate via intra-articular injection for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.
item.description: This project was part of a Biomaterials course. We proposed a liposome-based drug delivery system for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, aiming to increase the half-life of the drug, promote drug accumulation in the joints and reduce its systemic effect. For more information click on the ‘PDF’ button above.
